intro: Cochleariopsis groenlandica, commonly known as the Greenland cocklebur, is a flowering plant native to Arctic regions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, spiny fruits and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, thriving in cold, harsh environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
